greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Difference between product and sum of prime indices of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
example: The prime indices of 45 are {2,2,3}, with product 12 and sum 7, so a(45) = 5.
xref: Positions of zeros are A301987. Positions of ones are A325041. Positions of negative ones are A325042.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 25 2019
